alert.note: Alert for Stearns; Todd (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 13 at 2:31AM CST until January 14 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...LIGHT SNOW ENDING TODAY, DANGEROUSLY COLD TONIGHT INTO NEXT WEEK... .Scattered snow showers will continue today, but any accumulation will be less than an inch. Northwest wind gusts of 30 to 35 mph will lead to areas of blowing snow and reduced visibility, especially across western and southern Minnesota. Meanwhile, confidence remains high that dangerously cold wind chills will follow tonight, with widespread values of -25 to -40 likely through early next week. A Wind Chill Warning is in effect for western and southern Minnesota tonight through Sunday morning. A Wind Chill Advisory is in effect for eastern Minnesota and western Wisconsin tonight through Sunday morning. Looking ahead, these will likely need to be reissued again for Sunday night into Monday morning. ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST SUNDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...Todd and Stearns Counties. * WHEN...Until noon CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
